A profoundly stupid case about video game cheating could transform adblocking into a copyright infringement (permalink) Here's a weird consequence of our societal shift from capitalism (where riches come from profits) to feudalism (where riches come from rents): increasingly, your rights to your actual property (the physical stuff you own) are trumped by corporations' metaphorical "intellectual property" claims. That's a lot to unpack! Let's start with a quick primer on profits and rent
